title: information collection system (ics) for all shared objects
body:
hi everybody,
i was looking for an app that shows the number of times a shared file or folder has been downloaded regardless if it's been shared via link or between user accounts.
but there was none.

i talked to arkascha (author of the "shorty" app) who does something similar with his shortytracking app, to ask him how it could be done, but unfortunately his shorty tracker only works for the shorty app.
i also talked to mt-gap who suggested opening a new issue here. so here is what i think it should look like (please feel free to add info or correct me if i'm wrong).

first:
the system that shows the collected information should be optional. an app would be the best so the users are not forced to use it because it could cause problems in some country's (and other simply don't like it).

second:
collected information of the request:

- time and date
- ip/host
- access (authorised or denied)
- user name (if the request was authorised)
- object (id, name, type, owner etc.)
- more if you know something else that's useful

arkascha mentioned that it might be necessary to add a "hook" to the core sharing api because atm this information is not registered (or stored) in oc (please correct me if i'm wrong).
so it's basically a statistic tool (or app).

third:
at a later stage, it could be integrated in apps like userphoto and/or whoshare and the little popup they provide to show the information about the download as well. 
i like the possibility to disable a shared link by date, but with this it could also be disabled by download count e.g. 20 downloads and the link is disabled.

![ics_popup_ws_up](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4153852/554611/43d0e6dc-c3ad-11e2-88df-0c67bbbc0bb8.jpg)

fourth:
the name. how about "ics" app? 

i hope somebody understands what i think could be a useful tool for some users.

feel free to response.

stormsh
